intro: Stillingia patula, commonly known as the Pacific or western stellaria, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Stillingia patula is often found in regions with cool, temperate climates.
